_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:32:12 using v2.7
title: Does feeling supported to manage their long-term condition(s) differ by deprivation?
analysis_commentary:
Information published under the NHS Outcomes Framework also indicates a link between how people feel about being supported and levels of deprivation.

The least deprived patient group felt supported to manage their long-term condition(s) the most (68% in 2013/14) however there had been a slight decrease in those feeling supported in the two least deprived groups in 2013/14 compared to 2012/13. The most deprived patient group felt the least supported to manage their long-term condition(s) (61.9% in the most deprived), with a strong correlation between feeling positive about the support received and patient deprivation.
